intro: Phyllanthus nobilis var. hypomalacus, commonly known as the Indian liverwort, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-like growth pattern and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and adaptation.
